text: Hortense Marie Eugénie Pellet dite Alice Desgranges (1854 - 1927), was a French operatic singer. Alice Desgranges was born in Paris. The wife of composer Théodore Ritter, she is present on a painting by Edgar Degas (1878) kept at the Ordrupgaard in Copenhagen, a print by Marcellin Desboutin (1875)See on Gallica and through a poem by Jules Barbey d'Aurevilly, À Madame A. Ritter Desgranges. == Bibliography == * Gazette des Beaux-Arts, part I, 1980, (p. 162) (Long study on the meeting between Degas and Mlle Desgranges). == References == Category:1854 births Category:1927 deaths Category:19th- century French singers Category:Musicians from Paris
